SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Name of the country for the analysis. Check the available countries and regions here: https://www.naturalearthdata.com/downloads/10m-cultural-vectors/
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: country

SHS_pipeline.json@5|pipeline@77.description:
Source of the expert range map for the species. The options are:
Map of Life (MOL), International union for conservation of nature (IUCN) and range maps from the Ministère de l’Environnement du Québec (QC).
SHS_pipeline.json@5|pipeline@77.label: source of expert range map

SHS_pipeline.json@5|pipeline@76.description: Scientific name of the species. Multiple species names can be specified, separated with a comma.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|pipeline@76.label: species

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Raster with expected area for the species if choosing option "Raster"
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: range map (raster)

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Path to the study area file if you choosing option "User defined" for study area option. This file should be a polygon with a .gpkg extension or .shp (in this case do not foget to add the projection file to the folder).
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: study area

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Choose the source for the study area either if it should be at a country level and downloaded according to the 'country_code', at region level according to 'region' or a user defined polygon with the borders of the study area.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: study area option

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Size of the buffer around the study area. If it is not defined it will be estimated as half of the total width of the study area.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: buffer for study area

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Elevation buffer in meters to add (or substract) to the reported species elevation range. Default is zero. Positive values will increase the range in that value in meters and negative values will reduce the range in that value.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: elevation buffer

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: If 'yes' an elevation filter using IUCN information is applied, if 'no' the range map is taken as the area of habitat.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: filter by elevation

SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.description: Maximum tree cover percentage required for each species, based on suitable habitat of the species. Acts as a filter for the Global Forest Watch Data. If not available, use Map of Life Values (e.g. [https://mol.org/species/range/Saguinus_oedipus])
SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.label: max forest

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: Select type of range map according to the type of the source file: 1) polygon, 2) raster, 3) an intersection between the raster and polygon files.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: type of range map

SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.description: Year where the analysis should start. Starts in 2000, check the time interval available for the Global Forest Watch data at https://stac.geobon.org/collections/gfw-lossyear.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.label: initial time

SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.description: Temporal resolution for analysis given in number of years. To get values for the end year, time step should fit evenly into the given analysis range.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.label: time step

SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.description: Year where the analysis should end (it should be later than Initial time). It should be inside the time interval for the Global Forest Watch data at https://stac.geobon.org/collections/gfw-lossyear.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.label: final time

SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.description: Minimum tree cover percentage required for each species, based on suitable habitat of the species. Acts as a filter for the Global Forest Watch Data. If not available, use Map of Life Values (e.g. [https://mol.org/species/range/Saguinus_oedipus])
SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.label: min forest

SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.description: For cases when a more specific administrative boundary (than the country level) is required, a region name can be used. Check the available countries and regions here: https://www.naturalearthdata.com/downloads/10m-cultural-vectors/
SHS_pipeline.json@5|data>getAreaOfHabita.label: region

SHS_pipeline.json@5|pipeline@79.description: Spatial resolution (in meters) for the output of the analysis.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|pipeline@79.label: output spatial resolution

SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.description: Figure showing a map with changes in the habitat for the time range for each species.
SHS_pipeline.json@5|SHI>habitatChange_GF.label: SHS map

metadata.name: Hello World pipeline
metadata.description:
This very simple pipeline shows how to connect a single script to a single output.
The input of the script is left blank, thus becoming a pipeline input.
